means: 问（某人）有没有胆量（做某事）
Data Retrieval System （联合国 UNESCO）数据检索系统
[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 戴尔 Dear的变体

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含有"敢于冒险"之意。
means: venture ： 指冒风险试一试，或指有礼貌的反抗或反对。
chance ： 指碰运气、冒风险试试。
dare ： 可与venture换用，但语气较强，着重挑战或违抗。
hazard ： 主要指冒险作出某个选择，隐含碰运气意味。
risk ： 指不顾个人安危去干某事，侧重主动承担风险。

sentence.Network_en: People always think I'm a fool, and I dare say they're right.
sentence.Network_cn: 人们总认为我是个傻瓜，想必他们是对的。

sentence.Network_en: Don't speak to me like that. Don't you dare.
sentence.Network_cn: 不要那样跟我讲话。我不允许！

sentence.Network_en: When found, the children said they'd run away for a dare.
sentence.Network_cn: 找到这些孩子时，他们说自己是受了激将才出走的。

jx.jx_en_mean: used to indicate that one believes something is probable

lj.lj_ly: I dare say you've heard about her.
lj.lj_ls: 我敢说你肯定听说过她的事。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English durran, of Germanic origin; related to Gothic gadaursan, from an Indo-European root shared by Greek tharsein and Sanskrit dhr̦ș- 'be bold'

encyclopedia.content: 电影《DARE》 ◎片 名 Dare ◎译 名 敢不敢/胆量游戏 ◎年 代 2009 ◎国 家 美国 ◎类 别 剧情 ◎语 言 英语 ◎片 长 92 min ◎导 演 亚当·萨尔齐 Adam Salky ◎主 演 埃米·罗森 Emmy Rossum ....Alexa Walker 扎克·吉尔福德 Zach Gilford ....Johnny Drake Ashley Springer ....Ben Berger 鲁妮·玛拉 Rooney Mara ....Courtney Ana Gasteyer ....Ruth Berger Sandra Bernhard ....Dr. Serena Mohr 艾伦·卡明 Alan Cumming .

entry.def: If you do not dare to do something, you do not have enough courage to do it, or you do not want to do it because you fear the consequences. If you dare to do something, you do something which requires a lot of courage.

example.ex: Since he was stuck in a lift a year ago he hasn't dared to get back into one...
example.tran: 自从一年前被困在电梯里之后，他就再也没敢乘过电梯。

example.ex: Most people hate Harry but they don't dare to say so...
example.tran: 大多数人都对哈里敢怒不敢言。

entry.tran: 向…挑战;激…（做）；问…有没有胆量（做）
entry.def: If you dare someone to do something, you challenge them to prove that they are not frightened of doing it.

example.ex: Over coffee, she lit a cigarette, her eyes daring him to comment...
example.tran: 喝咖啡时，她点燃了一支烟，用挑衅的眼神看着他，谅他也不敢吭声。

example.ex: I dare you to sit through forty-five minutes with someone like Vincent!
example.tran: 我想你绝不敢和文森特这样的人一起坐上 45 分钟！

entry.def: A dare is a challenge which one person gives to another to do something dangerous or frightening.

example.ex: He'd do pretty much anything on a dare...
example.tran: 别人一激他，他就几乎什么事都做得出来。

example.ex: When found, the children said they'd run away for a dare.
example.tran: 找到这些孩子时，他们说自己是受了激将才出走的。

entry.def: If you say to someone 'don't you dare' do something, you are telling them not to do it and letting them know that you are angry.

example.ex: Don't speak to me like that. Don't you dare...
example.tran: 不要那样跟我讲话。我不允许！

example.ex: Allen, don't you dare go anywhere else, you hear?
example.tran: 艾伦，其他地方哪儿都不准去，听到了吗？

entry.tran: （表示震惊和愤怒) 你竟敢，你怎么敢
entry.def: You say 'how dare you'' when you are very shocked and angry about something that someone has done.

example.ex: How dare you pick up the phone and listen in on my conversations!...
example.tran: 你竟敢拿起电话偷听我的谈话！

example.ex: Suddenly the peace was destroyed by someone shouting, 'Get back! Go away! How dare you!'
example.tran: 突然平静被打破了，就听见有人在喊：“滚回去！滚开！大胆！”

entry.def: You use 'dare I say it' when you know that what you are going to say will disappoint or annoy someone.

example.ex: Politicians usually attract younger women, dare I say it, because of the status they have in society.
example.tran: 恕我直言，由于政客的社会地位，他们通常容易吸引一些年轻的女性。

entry.def: You can use 'I dare say' or 'I daresay' before or after a statement to indicate that you believe it is probably true.

example.ex: I dare say that the computer would provide a clear answer to that...
example.tran: 想必计算机能就其给出一个清楚的答案。

example.ex: People always think I'm a fool, and I dare say they're right...
example.tran: 人们总认为我是个傻瓜，想必他们是对的。

means.word_mean: 1. a challenge to do something dangerous or foolhardy;
1. take upon oneself; act presumptuously, without permission;
2. to be courageous enough to try or do something;

sentences.sentence: "I don't dare call him", "she dares to dress differently from the others"

auth_sentence.content: The Japanese never dare to start any war again.
auth_sentence.res_content: The Japanese never dare to start any war again.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The Japanese never dare to start any war again.

auth_sentence.content: She did not dare tell you she was leaving.
auth_sentence.res_content: She did not dare tell you she was leaving.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: She did not dare tell you she was leaving.

auth_sentence.content: No savage fierce...Will dare to soyl her Virgin purity.
auth_sentence.res_content: No savage fierce...Will dare to soyl her Virgin purity.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: No savage fierce...Will dare to soyl her Virgin purity.

Sentence.sentence: As America's first environmentalist, John Muir lived his life forever daring to undertake new adventures
They themselves would like to do it but don't dare to.
They dare to take up challenges.

sentences.en: He didn't dare to speak to her.
I dare you to jump over the stream.
sentences.cn: 我谅你不敢跳过这条小河。

means.word_mean: 激（某人做某事）；问（某人）有没有胆量（做某事）；谅（某人）没胆量（做某事）

sentences.en: I dared him, but he didn't.
sentences.cn: 我向他挑战, 可是他不敢应战。

means.word_mean: 敢尝试；敢做；敢冒…的险，敢冒(风险)

sentences.en: The explorers dared the dangers of the ice north.
sentences.cn: 探险者们敢于冒北方冰雪严寒的危险。

sentences.en: I daren't ask her for a rise.
I don't know whether he dare try.
sentences.cn: 我不知道他是否敢试一试。

sentences.en: She wanted the money badly, but she daren't ask for it.
sentences.cn: 她急需用钱, 但却不敢要。

sentences.en: He dare not mention the subject again.
sentences.cn: 他不敢再提起那个话题。

sentences.en: We're so late I daren't look at my watch.
sentences.cn: 我们太迟了, 我连手表都不敢看一眼。

sentences.en: I daren't think how much it's going to cost.
sentences.cn: 我没敢想这得花多少钱。

sentences.en: He dared not show that he was pleased.
sentences.cn: 他不敢表示自己觉得高兴。

sentences.en: Dare you tell him the news?
sentences.cn: 你敢告诉他这个消息吗?

sentences.en: I show him my new blouse but I dared not tell him how much it cost.
sentences.cn: 我给他看了我的新衬衫, 但没敢告诉他花了多少钱买的。

means.word_mean: 敢，敢于，大胆，无畏于，有足够的勇气(或胆量)

jushi.chinese: 勇敢的人们敢冒最大的危险。

jushi.english: I cannot suffer to be dared by any.
jushi.chinese: 我这个人就是禁不住人家用激将法来对付我。

jushi.english: I dared him, but he didn't.
jushi.chinese: 我向他挑战,可是他不敢应战。
